name: Ext_R5_TestPlan
title: Cross-version Extension for R5.TestPlan for use in FHIR R4
description: This cross-version extension represents TestPlan from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/TestPlan|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: Description of intented testing
element.definition: A plan for executing testing on an artifact or specifications.

element.short: Canonical identifier for this test plan, represented as a URI (globally unique)
element.definition: An absolute URI that is used to identify this test plan when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which an authoritative instance of this test plan is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the test plan is stored on different servers.

element.short: Canonical identifier for this test plan, represented as a URI (globally unique)
element.definition: An absolute URI that is used to identify this test plan when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which an authoritative instance of this test plan is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the test plan is stored on different servers.

element.short: Business version of the test plan
element.definition: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the test plan when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance.  This is an arbitrary value managed by the test plan author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence.

element.short: Business version of the test plan
element.definition: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the test plan when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance.  This is an arbitrary value managed by the test plan author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence.

element.short: How to compare versions
element.definition: Indicates the mechanism used to compare versions to determine which is more current.

element.short: How to compare versions
element.definition: Indicates the mechanism used to compare versions to determine which is more current.

element.short: Name for this test plan (computer friendly)
element.definition: A natural language name identifying the test plan. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

element.short: Name for this test plan (computer friendly)
element.definition: A natural language name identifying the test plan. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

element.short: Name for this test plan (human friendly)
element.definition: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the test plan.

element.short: Name for this test plan (human friendly)
element.definition: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the test plan.

element.short: draft | active | retired | unknown
element.definition: The status of this test plan. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

element.short: draft | active | retired | unknown
element.definition: The status of this test plan. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

binding.description: The lifecycle status of an artifact.

element.short: For testing purposes, not real usage
element.definition: A Boolean value to indicate that this test plan is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

element.short: For testing purposes, not real usage
element.definition: A Boolean value to indicate that this test plan is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

element.short: Date last changed
element.definition: The date (and optionally time) when the test plan was last significantly changed. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the test plan changes.

element.short: Date last changed
element.definition: The date (and optionally time) when the test plan was last significantly changed. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the test plan changes.

element.short: Name of the publisher/steward (organization or individual)
element.definition: The name of the organization or individual responsible for the release and ongoing maintenance of the test plan.

element.short: Name of the publisher/steward (organization or individual)
element.definition: The name of the organization or individual responsible for the release and ongoing maintenance of the test plan.

element.short: Contact details for the publisher
element.definition: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

element.short: Contact details for the publisher
element.definition: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

element.short: Natural language description of the test plan
element.definition: A free text natural language description of the test plan from a consumer's perspective.

element.short: Natural language description of the test plan
element.definition: A free text natural language description of the test plan from a consumer's perspective.

element.short: The context that the content is intended to support
element.definition: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate test plan instances.

element.short: The context that the content is intended to support
element.definition: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate test plan instances.

element.short: Intended jurisdiction where the test plan applies (if applicable)
element.definition: A legal or geographic region in which the test plan is intended to be used.

element.short: Intended jurisdiction where the test plan applies (if applicable)
element.definition: A legal or geographic region in which the test plan is intended to be used.

binding.description: Countries and regions within which this artifact is targeted for use.

element.short: Why this test plan is defined
element.definition: Explanation of why this test plan is needed and why it has been designed as it has.

element.short: Why this test plan is defined
element.definition: Explanation of why this test plan is needed and why it has been designed as it has.

element.short: Use and/or publishing restrictions
element.definition: A copyright statement relating to the test plan and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the test plan. The short copyright declaration (e.g. (c) '2015+ xyz organization' should be sent in the copyrightLabel element.

element.short: Use and/or publishing restrictions
element.definition: A copyright statement relating to the test plan and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the test plan. The short copyright declaration (e.g. (c) '2015+ xyz organization' should be sent in the copyrightLabel element.

element.short: Copyright holder and year(s)
element.definition: A short string (<50 characters), suitable for inclusion in a page footer that identifies the copyright holder, effective period, and optionally whether rights are resctricted. (e.g. 'All rights reserved', 'Some rights reserved').

element.short: Copyright holder and year(s)
element.definition: A short string (<50 characters), suitable for inclusion in a page footer that identifies the copyright holder, effective period, and optionally whether rights are resctricted. (e.g. 'All rights reserved', 'Some rights reserved').

element.short: The category of the Test Plan - can be acceptance, unit, performance
element.definition: The category of the Test Plan - can be acceptance, unit, performance, etc.

element.short: The category of the Test Plan - can be acceptance, unit, performance
element.definition: The category of the Test Plan - can be acceptance, unit, performance, etc.

binding.description: The high-level category for this plan.

element.short: What is being tested with this Test Plan - a conformance resource, or narrative criteria, or an external reference
element.definition: What is being tested with this Test Plan - a conformance resource, or narrative criteria, or an external reference...

element.short: What is being tested with this Test Plan - a conformance resource, or narrative criteria, or an external reference
element.definition: What is being tested with this Test Plan - a conformance resource, or narrative criteria, or an external reference...

element.short: A description of test tools to be used in the test plan - narrative for now
element.definition: A description of test tools to be used in the test plan.

element.short: A description of test tools to be used in the test plan - narrative for now
element.definition: A description of test tools to be used in the test plan.

element.short: The required criteria to execute the test plan - e.g. preconditions, previous tests
element.definition: The required criteria to execute the test plan - e.g. preconditions, previous tests...

element.short: Description of the dependency criterium
element.definition: A textual description of the criterium - what is needed for the dependency to be considered met.

element.short: Description of the dependency criterium
element.definition: A textual description of the criterium - what is needed for the dependency to be considered met.

element.short: Link to predecessor test plans
element.definition: Predecessor test plans - those that are expected to be successfully performed as a dependency for the execution of this test plan.

element.short: Link to predecessor test plans
element.definition: Predecessor test plans - those that are expected to be successfully performed as a dependency for the execution of this test plan.

element.short: The threshold or criteria for the test plan to be considered successfully executed - narrative
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents TestPlan.exitCriteria from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/TestPlan|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The threshold or criteria for the test plan to be considered successfully executed - narrative
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents TestPlan.exitCriteria from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/TestPlan|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The test cases that constitute this plan
element.definition: The individual test cases that are part of this plan, when they they are made explicit.

element.short: Sequence of test case in the test plan
element.definition: Sequence of test case - an ordinal number that indicates the order for the present test case in the test plan.

element.short: Sequence of test case in the test plan
element.definition: Sequence of test case - an ordinal number that indicates the order for the present test case in the test plan.

element.short: The scope or artifact covered by the case
element.definition: The scope or artifact covered by the case, when the individual test case is associated with a testable artifact.

element.short: The scope or artifact covered by the case
element.definition: The scope or artifact covered by the case, when the individual test case is associated with a testable artifact.

element.short: Required criteria to execute the test case
element.definition: The required criteria to execute the test case - e.g. preconditions, previous tests.

element.short: Description of the criteria
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents TestPlan.testCase.dependency.description from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/TestPlan|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: Description of the criteria
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents TestPlan.testCase.dependency.description from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/TestPlan|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: Link to predecessor test plans
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents TestPlan.testCase.dependency.predecessor from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/TestPlan|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: Link to predecessor test plans
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents TestPlan.testCase.dependency.predecessor from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/TestPlan|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The actual test to be executed
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents TestPlan.testCase.testRun from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/TestPlan|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The narrative description of the tests
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents TestPlan.testCase.testRun.narrative from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/TestPlan|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The narrative description of the tests
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents TestPlan.testCase.testRun.narrative from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/TestPlan|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The test cases in a structured language e.g. gherkin, Postman, or FHIR TestScript
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents TestPlan.testCase.testRun.script from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/TestPlan|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The language for the test cases e.g. 'gherkin', 'testscript'
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents TestPlan.testCase.testRun.script.language from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/TestPlan|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The language for the test cases e.g. 'gherkin', 'testscript'
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents TestPlan.testCase.testRun.script.language from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/TestPlan|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The actual content of the cases - references to TestScripts or externally defined content
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents TestPlan.testCase.testRun.script.source[x] from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/TestPlan|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The actual content of the cases - references to TestScripts or externally defined content
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents TestPlan.testCase.testRun.script.source[x] from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/TestPlan|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The test data used in the test case
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents TestPlan.testCase.testData from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/TestPlan|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The type of test data description, e.g. 'synthea'
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents TestPlan.testCase.testData.type from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/TestPlan|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The type of test data description, e.g. 'synthea'
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents TestPlan.testCase.testData.type from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/TestPlan|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The actual test resources when they exist
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents TestPlan.testCase.testData.content from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/TestPlan|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: The actual test resources when they exist
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents TestPlan.testCase.testData.content from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/TestPlan|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: Pointer to a definition of test resources - narrative or structured e.g. synthetic data generation, etc
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents TestPlan.testCase.testData.source[x] from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/TestPlan|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: Pointer to a definition of test resources - narrative or structured e.g. synthetic data generation, etc
element.definition: This cross-version extension represents TestPlan.testCase.testData.source[x] from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/TestPlan|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: Test assertions or expectations
element.definition: The test assertions - the expectations of test results from the execution of the test case.

element.short: Assertion type - for example 'informative' or 'required'
element.definition: The test assertion type - this can be used to group assertions as 'required' or 'optional', or can be used for other classification of the assertion.

element.short: Assertion type - for example 'informative' or 'required'
element.definition: The test assertion type - this can be used to group assertions as 'required' or 'optional', or can be used for other classification of the assertion.

element.short: The focus or object of the assertion
element.definition: The focus or object of the assertion i.e. a resource.

element.short: Reference to a concept (by class)
element.definition: A reference to a concept - e.g. the information is identified by its general class to the degree of precision found in the terminology.

element.short: Reference to a concept (by class)
element.definition: A reference to a concept - e.g. the information is identified by its general class to the degree of precision found in the terminology.

element.short: Reference to a resource (by instance)
element.definition: A reference to a resource the provides exact details about the information being referenced.

element.definition: A reference to a resource the provides exact details about the information being referenced.

element.short: Data type name for TestPlan.testCase.assertion.object from FHIR R5
element.definition: Data type name for TestPlan.testCase.assertion.object from FHIR R5

element.short: The actual result assertion
element.definition: The test assertion - the expected outcome from the test case execution.

element.short: Reference to a concept (by class)
element.definition: A reference to a concept - e.g. the information is identified by its general class to the degree of precision found in the terminology.

element.definition: A reference to a concept - e.g. the information is identified by its general class to the degree of precision found in the terminology.

element.short: Reference to a resource (by instance)
element.definition: A reference to a resource the provides exact details about the information being referenced.
